lines.text: I've been thinking.
Yeah?
Last year we were in the squirt league, and this year we're in the pewee.
So?
So what do they want us to do, play baseball or urinate? Anyway, I was just thinking.
Time is a monster that cannot be reasoned with. It responds like a snail to our impatience, then it races like a gazelle when you can't catch a breath.
What I want to do and what I do are two separate things. If we all went around doing what we wanted all the time, there'd be chaos.
Your mother is so sexy, sometimes I forget she's someone's mother.
What if I said the same thing about your mother?
I'd have you committed.
Sex makes people crazy.
You're already a bastard. Might as well be an enlightened one.
Boobs!

When someone you love dies, you don't lose them all at once. You lose them in pieces over time, like how the mail stops coming. What I remember most to this day was my mother's scent and how I hated it when it began to disappear. First from her closets, then from her dresses she had sewn herself and then finally from her bedsheets and pillow cases. Simon and I never talked much about that day on the baseball field. It was too painful for both of us. For as much as I loved my mother, I knew that Simon loved her just as much. She was the only real mother he ever had.
Hey, your son is not a screw up, he's a hero.
What?
I said he's a hero. And you don't deserve him. I want you to know that.
I said, what does coffee and donuts have to do with God?
They're merely refreshments so people can socialize and talk about up coming events.
Who ever said church needs a continental breakfast?
She's so sexy that sometimes I forget she's someone's mother.
Well, what if I said the same thing about your mother?
I'd have you committed.
If God's made the church bake sale a priority, we're in a lot of trouble.
I have faith. I just need proof to back it up.
What are you doing sitting in a corner Simon?
Thinking about God.
In a corner?
Faith is not in a floor plan.
My balls just turned to prunes!
My balls just turned to raisins!
It's the *Virgin* Mary, Eddie. What does Joseph have to do with anything?
I don't see how pork chops could lead to intercourse, no matter how good they are.
The Star of Bethlehem is not a piñata!
I'm a miracle you know.
Yeah, yeah, yeah.

[voiceover]
I am doomed to remember a boy with a wrecked voice, not because of his voice, or because he was the smallest person I ever knew, or even because he was the instrument of my mother's death, but because he is the reason I believe in God. What faith I have, I owe to Simon Birch, the boy I grew up with in Gravedown, Maine.
Ahh! It's a horse!
I don't think God's plan includes breaking and entering.
I look like a burn victim.
Now get over there with the other flying monkeys, where you belong.
The Virgin Mary does not chew gum.

Ben Goodrich legally adopted me just two days before my 13th birthday. Not a day that goes by that I don't thank God for bringing him into my life. With Simon's help, I had finally found my real father.
Thank you Miss Wenteworth.
You know what Simon? Thank you.
I'm sorry! I'm sorry!
Jesus, Simon, you look like shit.

[reading off remaining roles for the Christmas play]
... Well, there's the shepherds, but they don't do much -
[Everyone's hands spring up instantaneously]

[voicecover]
Miss Leavy always tried to downplay the role of the shepherds, but we weren't fooled. We knew that all you had to do was stand there with a staff and try not to laugh at all the poor fools with speaking parts.
